item.title: Braelynn Rebholz beginning bittersweet final high school volleyball season
item.description: This week’s ABC7 Athlete of the Week is Braelynn Rebholz. She’s a senior and one of the shining stars for the Sarasota High School volleyball program.

item.title: Suspect in 2011 Sarasota murder is again ruled incompetent to stand trial
item.description: William Case was case courts murder trial ordered him to be transferred to a state hospital.

item.title: Tim Enos to resign from Sarasota County School Board, returning to SCSPD
item.description: "My deepest passion has always been ensuring the safety of our students and staff.” – Enos

item.title: Attorney of suspected Florida State campus shooter plans to file motion for continuance
item.description: Ikner’s defense attorney, Peter Mills, said during the Wednesday hearing that he will not be ready for Ikner’s trial, which is currently scheduled for November 3.

item.description: An earlier vehicle fire closes I-275 at Sunshine Skyway Bridge.

item.title: Rain, heat, and Erin? The Suncoast’s busy weather week explained
item.description: Rain chances set to increase late this weekend.

item.title: Sarasota Police pull derelict boat out of Sarasota Bay
item.description: The vessel was sitting between Selby Gardens and the Marina Jack mooring field.

item.title: Looking back: Hurricane Charley hit 21 years ago
item.description: Charley caused $6.8 billion in insured losses which equates to about $13 billion in today’s dollars.

item.title: Bradenton school zone speed cameras catch 50 on the first day
item.description: The cameras are active 30 minutes before and 30 minutes after school hours.

item.title: UPDATE: Armed suspect killed after standoff with deputies in Venice, sheriff said
item.description: “We are fortunate enough that the sheriff provides us with the training that we need.”
